column4: Is there any particular reason you're advising to delete files out of /boot directly instead of just removing the relevant packages?
is there a better way?  i just rm the stuff in boot and do update-grub.
yes. Kernel packages are named linux-image-2.6.XX-YY-generic (assuming one's using the -generic kernel). Remove the ones not being used...
ha i didn't realize it was that easy.
